description:
This course applies IR theories to examine major security and economic
issues in East Asia.

This course promotes studentsâ ability to critically apply major international
relations theories to East Asia. The course also encourages students to
explore the possibilities of refining existing theories and developing new
alternatives.

On successful completion of the course a student should be able to: Identify
the actors, forces, and logics driving major international security and
economic issues in East Asia.
title: Conflict and Cooperation in East Asia
